questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions:
a) Why is 21 February a memorable day in our national history?
b) Who is responsible to raise a storm of protest and how? Describe.
c) How did the Pakistani government try to prevent the protest?
d) What did the students of Dhaka University do against the declaration of outlạiving all sorts of public meetings and rallies?
e) How is Language Movement related to Independence Movement of Bángladesh?

sub_questions.explanation:
a. February 21 is a memorable day in our national history because on this day in 1952, the heroic son's of Bengal laid down their lives to establish Bangla as a state language of the undivided Pakistan. On this day, we pay tribute to the language martyrs because of their sacrifice for the rightful place of mother tongue.
b. The then Governor General of Pakistan, Mohammad Ali Zinnah, is responsible to raise a storm of protest. In a public meeting in Dhaka, he declared Urdu as the only state language of Pakistan, which disregarded the language rights of the Bangalee. Therefore, a mass protest started across the country.
c. The Pakistani government banned all sorts of public meetings and gatherings to stop the protest that began following Mohammad Ali Jinnah's declaration of Urdu as the only state language of Pakistan and continued non-stop.
d. Against the declaration of outlawing all sorts of public meeting and rallies, the students of Dhaka University brought out a peaceful protest procession on 21 February, defying the law.
e. The Language Movement of 1952 kindled the sparks of independence movement in East Pakistan by making the Bangalees aware of their rights. Thus, the Language Movement is related to the independence movement of Bangladesh.

questions.uddipok:
Milton was a great poet after Shakespeare. His father early decided that Milton was to have a literary career. At the age of 7, in 1615 he got himself admitted in Star Palace School. But Milton could not pay attention to his studies in this school. After a couple of years, he left the school and studied at St. Paul's School till 1624. In the succeeding year, John Milton entered Christ College in Cambridge. He took his M.A degree at the age of 24 and went to his father's house in the village of Horton. Milton's father, however, had faith in his son and allowed him to continue his studies at Horton from 1632 to 1638 . During his time, he made himself master of everything worth knowing in the literature of Rome, Greece, Italy, France, Spain and the Bible. In 1643, Milton met Mary Powel in a occasion and married her. But this great poet became blind in 1652. The idea behind his famous work 'Paradise Lost' developed after his blindness. 'Paradise Lost' saw the light of the day in the year 1665. Nine years after its publications, this great artist in literature died.
Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: Milton, a great poet, was born in 1608 . He studied at Star Palace School and St. Paul's School. He entered Christ College in Cambridge in 1625. He received his MA degree from this institution at the age of 24 . His father was highly optimistic about his son's potential. Milton made himself a master of the literature of Rome, Greece, Italy, France, Spain and of the Bible between 1632 and 1638 at his father's home in Horton. His great work Paradise Lost was published after his blindness in 1665. He breathed his last in 1674.

(a) In the evening a lion entered the cave.
(b) One day he fled from the master's house and took shelter in a cave.
(c) Once upon a time, there lived a young man named Androcles.

sub_questions.explanation:
c + e + g + b + a + f + d + h c+e+g+b+a+f+d+h c + e + g + b + a + f + d + h
Once upon a time, there lived a young man named Androcles. He was caught by a slave-merchant who sold him to a richman in another country. His master was very bad and inflicted heavy torture on him. questions.uddipok:
Write a paragraph on 'Your School Library' by answering the following questions.
(a) What is a school library? (b) Where is it situated? (c) What kinds of books are there in your school library?
(d) What is the use of your school library? (e) How can you borrow books from there? (f) What sorts of books do you borrow from the library?

sub_questions.explanation:
Our School Library

A library is the place where various kinds of books, newspapers, magazines, etc, are kept for readers. A school library is only for the teachers and the students of a school. We have an up-to-date library in our school. It is housed in a separate one-storey building. It is quite spacious and well-ventilated. The books are arranged systemically in different bookshelves. So, we have no difficulty in finding out the expected books. Our school library has a good collection of text and reference books. It has also books on different branches of knowledge like literature, history, science, commerce, geography, travels, biography and so on. Besides, it has a good supply of newspapers, magazines and journals. Moreover, there is a librarian in charge of our school library. He is well-trained, qualified and experienced. Every student has a library card. We can borrow two books at a time. Nobody is allowed to keep a book for more than two weeks. In the library; discipline and silence is strictly maintained. While studying in the reading room, students are strictly prohibited to talk or disturb others in any way. The calm and quiet atmosphere of the library helps the students to work attentively. Our school library plays an important role in enriching both our academic and general knowledge. It provides us with the opportunity to read different types of books. To us, it is a storehouse of knowledge. I think, every educational institution should have a library. To conclude it can be said that no educational institute is a complete one without a library.

questions.uddipok:
Read the beginning of the following story. This story is not complete. Write at least ten new sentences to complete the story:
Robert Bruce was the king of Scotland. His army was defeated again and again against the King Edward-I of England. Being defeated for six times he lost his hope. \qquad

sub_questions.explanation:
Perseverance is the Key to Success

Robert Bruce was the king of Scotland. His Army was defeated again and again against the King Edward-I of England. Being defeated for six times, he lost his hope. Getting disappointed, he took shelter in a remote cave. Once, he was lying in the cave. Then he saw a spider trying hard to reach the ceiling of the cave. The spider failed again and again to succeed. But he did not give up hope. Bruce saw the spider climbing to the ceiling 'after some unsuccessful attempts. This dauntless spider inspired Bruce to shake off the darkness of despair. He gathered an army of strong men and attacked his enemies. The enemies courted defeat and Bruce regained his kingdom. It taught us that; 'perseverance is the key to success'.

questions.uddipok: The pie chart below shows the interest of the students of a secondary school in different subjects. Describe the chart in about 150 words. You should highlight and summarize the information given in the chart.

sub_questions.explanation:
The pie chart shows the subject preferences of students in a secondary school. It highlights their interest in four key subjects: Mathematics, Science, Bangla, and English. According to the chart, Mathematics is the most preferred subject, with 35% of the students showing interest in it. This is followed by Science, which attracts 25% of the students. Bangla is also popular, drawing the attention of 23% of the students. English, however, is the least chosen subject, with only 17% showing interest in it.
From the data, it is clear that students tend to favor subjects related to logic and reasoning, such as Mathematics and Science, over languages. This could be due to the growing importance of science and technology in modern education and career paths. Nonetheless, the significant interest in Bangla reflects a continued appreciation for the mother tongue. Overall, the chart shows a balanced but slightly science-leaning academic interest among students.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, your father lives abroad. He wants to know your progress of studies for the coming SSC Exam. Now, write a letter to him about your progress of studies. Imagine you are Rana/Rani and you live in Sonapur, Rangpur district.

sub_questions.explanation:
10 Green Road, Dhaka
10 January 2020

Dear Mother,
How are you? What about your physical condition? Is father too busy with his farm? Mother, please don't be tensed for me. I'm careful of my preparation for the ensuing SSC Examination. I'm confident that I'll make a brilliant result in the exam. I am following my study routine with care. I contact my class teachers regularly if I need. Don't feel anxious about my food or health. Meet you soon with a brilliant result. No more today. With love to Nidi and Joy.

Hasan

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Nadim/Nadia, you have a friend named Fahim/Fahima who does not read newspaper. Now, write a dialogue between you and your friend about the importance of reading newspaper.

sub_questions.explanation:
Nadim : Hi, Fahim? How're you?

Fahim : Fine, thanks. What're you doing?

Nadim : I'm reading a newspaper. Will you take a page?

Fahim : No, thanks. I don't read newspaper.

Nadim : What! It's really surprising!

Fahim : Why? What's the importance of reading newspaper?

Nadim : Well. Newspaper is a collection of current affairs of the world. Without reading it, you're like a frog in a dark well. Do you know what are the burning issues of our country now? Or, what's going on in our neighbouring countries?

Fahim : Really not.

Nadim : But I know, because I read newspapers regularly. Newspapers can provide you with the news of the home and abroad. It's especially important for the students as it's the best medium of enriching our general knowledge. For this, it's called the storehouse of knowledge.

Fahim : You're right.

Nadim : Newspaper can make you introduce to the culture and customs of different countries of the world. You can know some such important information which are applicable to your practical life.

Fahim : You've opened my eyes. Now, I can feel the necessity of reading newspapers. Really, I'm detached from the current world. But I promise, I'll build up the
habit of reading newspaper from today. Thank you very much.

Nadim : You're most welcome.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions.

a. Where does Meherjan live?

b. Who are the worst sufferers of climate change?

c. What crushed Meherjan's dream and happiness? How?

d. What property did Meherjan lose due of river erosion?

e. What will hapepen if we cannot control river erosion?

f. Do you agree with the view that we should take prompt actions to adapt to climate change? Why?

sub_questions.explanation:
(a) Meherjan lives in a polythene-roofed shelter in a. slum on the Sirajgonj, Town Protection Embankment.

(b) The people who live along the river banks are the worst sufferers of climate change. It is because climate change has increased river erosion.

(c) The greedy Jamuna crushed Meherjan's dream and happiness by eating up her landed property, house, trees, vegetable garden and the bamboo bush.

(d) Meherjan lost her home, cultivable land, trees, vegetable garden, and the bamboo bush due to river erosion.

(e) If we cannot control river erosion, many more people like Meherjan will become homeless every year in Bangladesh. River erosion is a major threat caused by climate change and affects the lives of thousands of people every year.

(f) Yes, I agree with the view. It is because climate change is the main reason of river erosion. So, we have to stop polluting the environment first. Then, we have to dredge our rivers and make embankment to adapt to the change.
